مَنْ أَنْظَرَ مُعْسِرًا كَانَ لَهُ بِكُلِّ يَوْمٍ صَدَقَةٌ ، وَمَنْ أَنْظَرَهُ بَعْدَ حِلِّهِ كَانَ لَهُ مِثْلُهُ ، فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ صَدَقَةٌ.

Whoever gives respite to a debtor in difficulty will have the reward of giving charity every day. And whoever extends the time for repayment after the due date will have the reward of giving charity (equal to the amount of the loan) every day.

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 2418 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Jabir (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَيْنَ الْعَبْدِ وَبَيْنَ الْكُفْرِ تَرْكُ الصَّلاَةِ

The difference between a servant and disbelief is abandoning prayer.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 4678

Footnote:

Intentionally abandoning prayer cannot be the act of a Muslim. Abandoning prayer is the act of a disbeliever. If someone intentionally abandons a prayer, it is as if he has erased this distinction between a believer and a disbeliever. However, if someone abandons prayer while still considering it a sin, he will not become a disbeliever because of this crime. He will be a fasiq (transgressor). But if someone does not consider abandoning prayer a sin at all, then he will become a disbeliever.

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), from the Prophet (peace be upon him). He said,

إِذَا سَمِعْتُمُ الإِقَامَةَ فَامْشُوا إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ وَعَلَيْكُمْ بِالسَّكِينَةِ وَالْوَقَارِ ، وَلاَ تُسْرِعُوا فَمَا أَدْرَكْتُمْ فَصَلُّوا وَمَا فَاتَكُمْ فَأَتِمُّوا

When you hear the iqamah, walk to the prayer. You should maintain calmness and dignity. Do not rush. Whatever you catch up with the imam, pray it, and whatever you miss, complete it.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 636 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 608 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

It is forbidden to rush and run to the mosque to join the congregation. Even if the prayer has started or a rak'ah is about to be missed, one should walk normally.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

وَ عَاشِرُوْهُنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ

And live with them (i.e., women) in kindness.

Surah An-Nisa, Verse 19 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

That is, you should fulfill all the rights of your wives properly. Do not cause them any unnecessary trouble. Do not place any unjust burden on them. Fulfill their maintenance according to your ability, and do not fall short in this regard. Also, maintain all etiquette in your behavior with them. Above all, live with them with justice, fairness, and generosity.

Narrated by Abu Dharr (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

فَمَنْ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ أَخَاهُ تَحْتَ يَدِهِ فَلْيُطْعِمْهُ مِمَّا يَأْكُلُ وَلْيُلْبِسْهُ مِمَّا يَلْبَسُ ، وَلاَ يُكَلِّفُهُ مِنَ الْعَمَلِ مَا يَغْلِبُهُ فَإِنْ كَلَّفَهُ مَا يَغْلِبُهُ فَلْيُعِنْهُ عَلَيْهِ

So, whoever Allah has placed his brother under his authority, let him feed him from what he eats and clothe him from what he wears. And let him not burden him with any work that is beyond his capacity. And if he has to burden him with such a difficult task, then he himself should help him with it.

Sahih Al-Bukhari, Hadith 6050 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5624 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

كُلُّ أُمَّتِي يَدْخُلُونَ الْجَنَّةَ إِلاَّ مَنْ أَبَى قَالُوا : يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ ، وَمَنْ يَأْبَى قَالَ مَنْ أَطَاعَنِي دَخَلَ الْجَنَّةَ ، وَمَنْ عَصَانِي فَقَدْ أَبَى.

All of my ummah will enter Paradise, except for those who refuse. They said, 'Who will refuse?' He said: 'Whoever follows me will enter Paradise. And whoever disobeys me has refused.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 7280 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6783 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Usama ibn Sharik (RA), he said,

قالت الأعراب يا رسول الله ألا نتداوى ؟ قال نعم يا عباد الله تداووا فإن الله لم يضع داء إلا وضع له شفاء أو قال دواء إلا داء واحد قالوا يا رسول الله وما هو ؟ قال الهرم

The Bedouin Arabs once said, 'O Messenger of Allah! Shall we not seek medical treatment?' He said, 'Yes, O servants of Allah! Seek medical treatment. Allah has not created any disease for which He has not provided a cure.' Or he said, 'a medicine, except for one disease.' The companions asked: 'O Messenger of Allah! What is that disease?' He said: 'Old age.'

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2038 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 2045 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Aishah (RA),

أَنَّ رَجُلاً أَتَى النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى الله عَليْهِ وسَلَّمَ فَقَالَ : إِنَّ أُمِّي افْتُلِتَتْ نَفْسُهَا وَلَمْ تُوصِ ، وَإِنِّي أَظُنُّهَا لَوْ تَكَلَّمَتْ لَتَصَدَّقَتْ ، فَلَهَا أَجْرٌ إِنْ تَصَدَّقْتُ عَنْهَا وَلِيَ أَجْرٌ ؟ فَقَالَ : نَعَمْ.

A man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said, 'My mother died suddenly and could not make a will. I think if she had been able to speak, she would have given in charity. Will she have a reward if I give in charity on her behalf, and will I also have a reward?' He said, 'Yes.'

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 2717 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Footnote:

This hadith shows that if charity is given on behalf of a deceased person, both the deceased person and the one who gives the charity will be rewarded.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

وَ اَقِمِ الصَّلٰوةَ طَرَفَیِ النَّهَارِ وَ زُلَفًا مِّنَ الَّیْلِ ؕ اِنَّ الْحَسَنٰتِ یُذْهِبْنَ السَّیِّاٰتِ ؕ ذٰلِكَ ذِكْرٰی لِلذّٰكِرِیْنَۚ۝۱۱۴

And (O Prophet!) establish prayer at the two ends of the day and in some parts of the night. Indeed, good deeds remove evil deeds. This is a reminder for those who remember.

Surah Hud, Verse 114 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

According to many commentators, the prayers at the two ends of the day here refer to the prayers before sunrise and sunset. The prayer before sunrise is Fajr, and the prayers before sunset are Dhuhr and Asr. The prayers of the night are intended to be Maghrib and Isha. In this way, this verse contains instructions for the five daily prayers. Some, however, have also mentioned Tahajjud along with Maghrib-Isha as the prayers of the night. [Based on Tafsir-e-Usmani]

Narrated by Anas ibn Malik (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

لاَ تَبَاغَضُوا ، وَلاَ تَحَاسَدُوا ، وَلاَ تَدَابَرُوا وَكُونُوا عِبَادَ اللهِ إِخْوَانًا ، وَلاَ يَحِلُّ لِمُسْلِمٍ أَنْ يَهْجُرَ أَخَاهُ فَوْقَ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ.

Do not hate one another. Do not be jealous of one another. Do not turn your backs on one another. Be servants of Allah, brothers. It is not permissible for a Muslim to forsake his brother for more than three days (i.e., not to speak to him).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6065 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5639 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Amr (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

يَحْضُرُ الْجُمُعَةَ ثَلاَثَةُ نَفَرٍ رَجُلٌ حَضَرَهَا يَلْغُو وَهُوَ حَظُّهُ مِنْهَا وَرَجُلٌ حَضَرَهَا يَدْعُو فَهُوَ رَجُلٌ دَعَا اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ إِنْ شَاءَ أَعْطَاهُ وَإِنْ شَاءَ مَنَعَهُ وَرَجُلٌ حَضَرَهَا بِإِنْصَاتٍ وَسُكُوتٍ وَلَمْ يَتَخَطَّ رَقَبَةَ مُسْلِمٍ وَلَمْ يُؤْذِ أَحَدًا فَهِىَ كَفَّارَةٌ إِلَى الْجُمُعَةِ الَّتِى تَلِيهَا وَزِيَادَةُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ وَذَلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ يَقُولُ (مَنْ جَاءَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ عَشْرُ أَمْثَالِهَا)

Three types of people attend the Friday prayer in the mosque. One type of person attends the Jumu'ah, wanders around, and speaks idly. Another type of person comes to the Jumu'ah and engages in supplication, etc. Allah may or may not accept their supplication. Another type of person attends the mosque, remains silent during the sermon, does not walk over the necks of others, and does not harm anyone. For that person, this silence will be an expiation for sins from the previous Jumu'ah until this one, and for an additional three days. This is because Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, says, 'Whoever does a good deed will be rewarded ten times for it.'

Sunan Abu Dawood 1113 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Footnote:

It is forbidden to cause trouble to anyone or to step over someone to go forward in the mosque. One should sit wherever one finds a place upon entering the mosque. However, from the beginning, everyone should sit in such a way that there are no empty spaces in the front rows, so that there is no need for people to step over others from behind to come forward. This rule applies to all prayers, including Jumu'ah.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا لَا تَدْخُلُوْا بُیُوْتًا غَیْرَ بُیُوْتِكُمْ حَتّٰی تَسْتَاْنِسُوْا وَ تُسَلِّمُوْا عَلٰۤی اَهْلِهَا ؕ ذٰلِكُمْ خَیْرٌ لَّكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُوْنَ۝۲۷ فَاِنْ لَّمْ تَجِدُوْا فِیْهَاۤ اَحَدًا فَلَا تَدْخُلُوْهَا حَتّٰی یُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ ۚ وَ اِنْ قِیْلَ لَكُمُ ارْجِعُوْا فَارْجِعُوْا هُوَ اَزْكٰی لَكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُوْنَ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۸

O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own until you have asked permission and greeted their inhabitants. That is better for you; perhaps you will take heed. And if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter them until permission has been given you. And if you are told, 'Go back,' then go back. It is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.

Surah An-Nur, Verses 27, 28

Narrated by Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ كَانَ لَهُ ثَلاَثُ بَنَاتٍ أَوْ ثَلاَثُ أَخَوَاتٍ أَوْ ابْنَتَانِ أَوْ أُخْتَانِ فَأَحْسَنَ صُحْبَتَهُنَّ وَاتَّقَى اللَّهَ فِيهِنَّ فَلَهُ الجَنَّةُ

Whoever has three daughters or three sisters, or two daughters or two sisters, and he treats them well and fears Allah regarding them (their rights), then Paradise is ordained for him.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1916 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 1922 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوْا ثُمَّ اٰمَنُوْا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوْا ثُمَّ ازْدَادُوْا كُفْرًا لَّمْ یَكُنِ اللّٰهُ لِیَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ وَ لَا لِیَهْدِیَهُمْ سَبِیْلًاؕ۝۱۳۷

Those who believed, then disbelieved, then believed, then disbelieved, then increased in disbelief - Allah will not forgive them, nor will He guide them to the right path.

Surah An-Nisa, Verse 137

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا أَكَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَلْعَقْ أَصَابِعَهُ ، فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَدْرِي فِي أَيَّتِهِنَّ البَرَكَةُ.

When one of you eats, he should lick his fingers, for he does not know in which of them the blessing lies.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1801 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 1808 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ شَرِبَ الخَمْرَ لَمْ تُقْبَلْ لَهُ صَلاَةٌ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، فَإِنْ عَادَ لَمْ يَقْبَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ صَلاَةً أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، فَإِنْ عَادَ لَمْ يَقْبَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ صَلاَةً أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، فَإِنْ عَادَ الرَّابِعَةَ لَمْ يَقْبَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ صَلاَةً أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ لَمْ يَتُبِ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، وَسَقَاهُ مِنْ نَهْرِ الخَبَالِ قِيلَ : يَا أَبَا عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ : وَمَا نَهْرُ الخَبَالِ ؟ قَالَ : نَهْرٌ مِنْ صَدِيدِ أَهْلِ النَّارِ.

Whoever drinks alcohol, his prayer will not be accepted for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will accept his repentance. If he drinks alcohol again, Allah will not accept his prayer for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will accept his repentance. If he gets involved in drinking alcohol again, Allah will not accept his prayer for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will accept his repentance. If he gets involved in drinking alcohol for the fourth time, Allah will not accept his prayer for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will not accept his repentance and will make him drink from the 'Nahrul Khabal'. It was asked, 'O Abu Abdur Rahman (Ibn Umar)! What is Nahrul Khabal?' He said, 'A river of pus of the people of Hell.'

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1862 (Verified by Bashar Awad and Ahmad Shakir) 1868 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

The matter of not being forgiven and the repentance not being accepted the fourth time is said as a warning. In another hadith, it is said that if one commits a sin seventy times a day and repents, Allah Ta'ala will also accept it.

Narrated by Ali (Zainul Abidin) ibn al-Husayn (may Allah have mercy on him), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ مِنْ حُсْنِ إِسْلاَمِ الْمَرْءِ تَرْكَهُ مَا لاَ يَعْنِيهِ.

One of the qualities of a person's Islam is to leave alone what does not concern him.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2318 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 2321 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), Abu Huraira (RA) narrated from the Prophet (peace be upon him):

أَنَّ رَجُلاً زَارَ أَخًا لَهُ فِى قَرْيَةٍ أُخْرَى فَأَرْصَدَ اللَّهُ لَهُ عَلَى مَدْرَجَتِهِ مَلَكًا فَلَمَّا أَتَى عَلَيْهِ قَالَ أَيْنَ تُرِيدُ قَالَ أُرِيدُ أَخًا لِى فِى هَذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ. قَالَ هَلْ لَكَ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ تَرُبُّهَا قَالَ لاَ غَيْرَ أَنِّى أَحْبَبْتُهُ فِى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ. قَالَ فَإِنِّى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيْكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ قَدْ أَحَبَّكَ كَمَا أَحْبَبْتَهُ فِيهِ

A man went to visit his brother in another village. Allah Ta'ala appointed an angel for him on the road. When the man reached the angel, the angel asked, 'Where do you intend to go?' He said, 'I am going to visit a brother of mine in this village.' The angel said, 'Do you have any favor upon him that you want to increase?' He said, 'No. I only love him for the sake of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic.' The angel said, 'I have come to you with a message from Allah that Allah also loves you, just as you have loved your brother for His sake.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2567 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6316 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn Mas'ud (RA), he said,

لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ آكِلَ الرِّبَا ، وَمُوكِلَهُ ، وَشَاهِدَيْهِ ، وَكَاتِبَهُ.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the one who consumes usury, the one who gives it, the two who witness it, and the one who writes it (the contract or account).

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1206 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 1209 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الرِّبَا سَبْعُونَ حُوبًا، أَيْسَرُهَا أَنْ يَنْكِحَ الرَّجُلُ أُمَّهُ

Usury is a collection of seventy types of sins. The easiest of them is for a man to commit adultery with his own mother.

Sunan Ibn Majah 2274 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا النَّبِیُّ قُلْ لِّاَزْوَاجِكَ وَ بَنٰتِكَ وَ نِسَآءِ الْمُؤْمِنِیْنَ یُدْنِیْنَ عَلَیْهِنَّ مِنْ جَلَابِیْبِهِنَّ ؕ ذٰلِكَ اَدْنٰۤی اَنْ یُّعْرَفْنَ فَلَا یُؤْذَیْنَ ؕ وَ كَانَ اللّٰهُ غَفُوْرًا رَّحِیْمًا۝

O Prophet! Tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments. That is more suitable that they will be known and not be abused. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah Al-Ahzab, Verse 59 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

This verse clearly proves that a woman's face is also part of her hijab. There is no scope for keeping the face uncovered in front of non-mahram men.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

كُنْتُمْ خَیْرَ اُمَّةٍ اُخْرِجَتْ لِلنَّاسِ تَاْمُرُوْنَ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ وَ تَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ وَ تُؤْمِنُوْنَ بِاللّٰهِ ؕ وَ لَوْ اٰمَنَ اَهْلُ الْكِتٰبِ لَكَانَ خَیْرًا لَّهُمْ ؕ مِنْهُمُ الْمُؤْمِنُوْنَ وَ اَكْثَرُهُمُ الْفٰسِقُوْنَ۝۱۱۰

(O Muslims!) You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah. If only the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.

Surah Aal-i-Imran, Verse 110 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Narrated by Jabir (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عز وجل عِنْدَ كُلِّ فِطْرٍ عُتَقَاءَ، وَذَلِكَ فِي كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ

Allah Ta'ala frees a large number of people (from Hell) at the time of every Iftar. And this happens every night.

Sunan Ibn Majah 1643 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Aisha (RA), she said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا أَكَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَذْكُرِ اسْمَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى فَإِنْ نَسِىَ أَنْ يَذْكُرَ اسْمَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى فِى أَوَّلِهِ فَلْيَقُلْ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ أَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ

When one of you eats, let him say 'Bismillah'. If he forgets to say Bismillah at the beginning of the meal, then let him say, 'Bismillahi awwalahu wa akhirahu' (I am eating in the name of Allah, at the beginning and at the end).

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 3767 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut) 3725 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

That is, my eating begins in the name of Allah, ends in the name of Allah, and the middle part is also in the name of Allah.

Narrated by ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Amr (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

الْمُسْلِمُ مَنْ سَلِمَ الْمُسْلِمُونَ مِنْ لِسَانِهِ وَيَدِهِ وَالْمُهَاجِرُ مَنْ هَجَرَ مَا نَهَى اللَّهُ عَنْهُ.

The true Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hand all Muslims are safe, and the true Muhajir is the one who gives up what Allah has forbidden.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 10 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 9 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Ya'la Shaddad ibn Aws (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

الْكَيِّسُ مَنْ دَانَ نَفْسَهُ ، وَعَمِلَ لِمَا بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ ، وَالْعَاجِزُ ، مَنْ أَتْبَعَ نَفْسَهُ هَوَاهَا ، ثُمَّ تَمَنَّى عَلَى اللَّهِ.

The wise person is the one who takes account of himself and works for what is after death. And the weak (foolish) person is the one who follows his own desires and then hopes from Allah.

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 4260

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَادِرُوا بِالأَعْمَالِ فِتَنًا كَقِطَعِ اللَّيْلِ الْمُظْلِمِ يُصْبِحُ الرَّجُلُ مُؤْمِنًا وَيُمْسِى كَافِرًا أَوْ يُمْسِى مُؤْمِنًا وَيُصْبِحُ كَافِرًا يَبِيعُ دِينَهُ بِعَرَضٍ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا

Hasten to do good deeds before a tribulation comes like patches of a dark night. A man will be a believer in the morning and a disbeliever in the evening, or a believer in the evening and a disbeliever in the morning. He will sell his religion for a worldly gain.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 118, Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2195

Abu Hurayrah (RA) said,

جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ أَيُّ الصَّدَقَةِ أَعْظَمُ أَجْرًا قَالَ : أَنْ تَصَدَّقَ وَأَنْتَ صَحِيحٌ شَحِيحٌ تَخْشَى الْفَقْرَ وَتَأْمُلُ الْغِنَى ، وَلاَ تُمْهِلْ حَتَّى إِذَا بَلَغَتِ الْحُلْقُومَ قُلْتَ لِفُلاَنٍ كَذَا وَلِفُلاَنٍ كَذَا وَقَدْ كَانَ لِفُلاَنٍ.

A man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said, 'O Messenger of Allah! Which charity has the greatest reward?' He said, 'To give charity when you are healthy and greedy, fearing poverty and hoping for wealth. Do not delay until, when death is at your throat, you say, "For so-and-so this much, and for so-and-so that much," when it already belongs to so-and-so.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1419, Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1032 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 90

Zubair ibn Adi (may Allah have mercy on him) said, We came to Anas ibn Malik (RA) and complained about the oppression of Hajjaj (ibn Yusuf). He said:

اصْبِرُوا ، فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَأْتِي عَلَيْكُمْ زَمَانٌ إِلاَّ الَّذِي بَعْدَهُ شَرٌّ مِنْهُ حَتَّى تَلْقَوْا رَبَّكُمْ سَمِعْتُهُ مِنْ نَبِيِّكُمْ صلى الله عليه وسلم

Be patient. For no time will come upon you but the time following it will be worse, until you meet your Lord. I heard this from your Prophet (peace be upon him).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 7068 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 92

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَادِرُوا بِالأَعْمَالِ سَبْعًا هَلْ تُنْظَرُونَ إِلاَّ إِلَى فَقْرٍ مُنْسٍ ، أَوْ غِنًى مُطْغٍ ، أَوْ مَرَضٍ مُفْسِدٍ ، أَوْ هَرَمٍ مُفَنِّدٍ ، أَوْ مَوْتٍ مُجْهِزٍ ، أَوِ الدَّجَّالِ فَشَرُّ غَائِبٍ يُنْتَظَرُ ، أَوِ السَّاعَةِ فَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَى وَأَمَرُّ.

Hasten to do good deeds before seven things. Are you waiting for a poverty that makes you forget, or a wealth that makes you transgress, or a sickness that disables you, or an old age that makes you senile, or a sudden death, or the Dajjal - for he is the worst of the awaited absent ones, or the Hour, and the Hour is more calamitous and more bitter?

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2306 (Verified by Bashar Awad) Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 93

Narrated by Rabi'a ibn Ka'b (RA), he said,

كُنْتُ أَبِيتُ مَعَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- فَأَتَيْتُهُ بِوَضُوئِهِ وَحَاجَتِهِ فَقَالَ لِى « سَلْ ». فَقُلْتُ أَسْأَلُكَ مُرَافَقَتَكَ فِى الْجَنَّةِ. قَالَ « أَوَغَيْرَ ذَلِكَ ». قُلْتُ هُوَ ذَاكَ. قَالَ « فَأَعِنِّى عَلَى نَفْسِكَ بِكَثْرَةِ السُّجُودِ »

I used to spend the night with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). I would bring him his water for ablution and his other needs. One day he said to me, 'Ask me for something.' I said, 'I ask to be with you in Paradise.' He said, 'Anything else besides that?' I said, 'No, that is it.' He said, 'Then help me to fulfill this hope of yours by prostrating frequently.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 489 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 106

Footnote:

In this hadith, prostrating frequently means praying frequently. A servant can attain the closest proximity to Allah Ta'ala through prayer. And within the prayer, the servant is closest to Allah during prostration.

Narrated by Salama ibn al-Akwa (RA),

أَنَّ رَجُلاً أَكَلَ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- بِشِمَالِهِ فَقَالَ « كُلْ بِيَمِينِكَ ». قَالَ لاَ أَسْتَطِيعُ قَالَ « لاَ اسْتَطَعْتَ ». مَا مَنَعَهُ إِلاَّ الْكِبْرُ. قَالَ فَمَا رَفَعَهَا إِلَى فِيهِ.

A man was eating with his left hand in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). He told him, 'Eat with your right hand.' He said, 'I cannot.' He said, 'May you not be able to.' Nothing prevented him from doing so except pride. After that, he could not raise his (right) hand to his mouth.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2021 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 3rd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 159

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Mas'ud (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

لاَ تُقْتَلُ نَفْسٌ ظُلْمًا إِلاَّ كَانَ عَلَى ابْنِ آدَمَ الأَوَّلِ كِفْلٌ مِنْ دَمِهَا لأَنَّهُ أَوَّلُ مَنْ سَنَّ الْقَتْلَ.

No person is killed unjustly but a share of the sin of the bloodshed falls on the first son of Adam (peace be upon him). Because he was the first person to initiate the act of killing.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 3335 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 3rd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 172

Narrated by Abu Mas'ud 'Uqba ibn 'Amr (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ دَلَّ عَلَى خَيْرٍ فَلَهُ مِثْلُ أَجْرِ فَاعِلِهِ

Whoever guides someone to a good deed will have a reward equal to that of the one who does it.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1893 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 3rd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 173

Footnote:

The one who calls to a good deed will receive the same reward as the one who performs it. So if we encourage someone to do a good deed, as long as that person continues to do the good deed, we will share in their reward. Even after our death, this reward will continue to be added to our record of deeds.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ دَعَا إِلَى هُدًى كَانَ لَهُ مِنَ الأَجْرِ مِثْلُ أُجُورِ مَنْ تَبِعَهُ لاَ يَنْقُصُ ذَلِكَ مِنْ أُجُورِهِمْ شَيْئًا وَمَنْ دَعَا إِلَى ضَلاَلَةٍ كَانَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الإِثْمِ مِثْلُ آثَامِ مَنْ تَبِعَهُ لاَ يَنْقُصُ ذَلِكَ مِنْ آثَامِهِمْ شَيْئًا

Whoever calls to guidance will have a reward equal to that of those who follow him. This will not diminish their rewards in any way. And whoever calls to misguidance will have a sin equal to that of those who follow him. This will not diminish their sins in any way.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2674 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 3rd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 173

Footnote:

If we invite someone to a good deed and that person performs it, we will also receive a reward equal to that of performing the deed. This will not diminish the reward of that person in any way. And if we show someone the path to a sin, we will also have to bear an equal share of that sin. Those of us who promote various dramas, movies, etc. on social media. Those of us who get our friends addicted to beedis, cigarettes, and various intoxicants. They need to think a little. This chain of sin can continue even after death.

Narrated by Al-Bara' ibn 'Azib (RA), he said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said to me:

إِذَا أَتَيْتَ مَضْجَعَكَ فَتَوَضَّأْ وَضُوءَكَ لِلصَّلاَةِ ثُمَّ اضْطَجِعْ عَلَى شِقِّكَ الأَيْمَنِ وَقُلِ اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِي إِلَيْكَ وَفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِي إِلَيْكَ وَأَلْجَأْتُ ظَهْرِي إِلَيْكَ رَهْبَةً وَرَغْبَةً إِلَيْكَ لاَ مَلْجَأَ ، وَلاَ مَنْجَا مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِلَيْكَ آمَنْتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الَّذِي أَنْزَلْتَ وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلْتَ فَإِنْ مُتَّ مُتَّ عَلَى الْفِطْرَةِ فَاجْعَلْهُنَّ آخِرَ مَا تَقُولُ

When you want to go to your bed, perform ablution as you would for prayer. Then lie down on your right side. And recite this supplication, اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ إِلَيْكَ وَفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِيْ إِلَيْكَ وَأَلْجَأْتُ ظَهْرِيْ إِلَيْكَ رَهْبَةً وَرَغْبَةً إِلَيْكَ لاَ مَلْجَأَ وَلاَ مَنْجَا مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِلَيْكَ آمَنْتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الَّذِي أَنْزَلْتَ وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الَّذِيْ أَرْسَلْتَ Meaning: O Allah! I have submitted my face (i.e., all my limbs) to You. And I have entrusted all my affairs to You and I have placed my back in Your protection. I am fearful of Your wrath and hopeful of Your mercy. There is no refuge and no place of salvation from You except to You. I have believed in the Book that You have revealed and I have believed in the Prophet that You have sent. If you die that night, your death will be considered as being on the natural religion of Islam. Therefore, let these supplications be the last words of your night.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6311 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5872 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Umar ibn al-Khattab (RA), he said the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ تَوَضَّأَ فَأَحْسَنَ الوُضُوءَ ثُمَّ قَالَ : أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ ، اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِي مِنَ التَّوَّابِينَ ، وَاجْعَلْنِي مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِينَ ، فُتِحَتْ لَهُ ثَمَانِيَةُ أَبْوَابِ الجَنَّةِ يَدْخُلُ مِنْ أَيِّهَا شَاءَ.

If a person performs ablution very well and then recites this supplication, all eight gates of Paradise will be opened for him, and he will be able to enter Paradise through whichever gate he wishes. The supplication is this- أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُوْلُهُ اَللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ التَّوَّابِيْنَ وَاجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِيْنَ Meaning: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, He is one, He has no partner; I also bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His Messenger; O Allah! Include me among those who repent and include me among the pure.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 55 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir)

Narrated by Jabir ibn ‘Abdullah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ قَالَ حِينَ يَسْمَعُ النِّدَاءَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ هَذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيلَةَ وَالْفَضِيلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَحْمُودًا الَّذِي وَعَدْتَهُ حَلَّتْ لَهُ شَفَاعَتِي يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

Whoever recites the supplication after hearing the adhan: اَللّهُمَّ رَبَّ هذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ، وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ، آتِ مُحَمَّداً الْوَسِيْلَةَ وَالْفَضِيْلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَاماً مَّحْمُوْداً الَّذِيْ وَعَدْتَّهُ 'O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and established prayer, grant Muhammad the Wasilah and the highest honor, and raise him to the praised station that You have promised him' –he will be entitled to my intercession on the Day of Resurrection.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 614 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 587 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Nu'man ibn Bashir (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الْمُسْلِمُونَ كَرَجُلٍ وَاحِدٍ إِنِ اشْتَكَى عَيْنُهُ اشْتَكَى كُلُّهُ وَإِنِ اشْتَكَى رَأْسُهُ اشْتَكَى كُلُّهُ

All Muslims are like one person. If his eye is afflicted, his whole body becomes sick. If his head is sick, then his whole body becomes sick.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2586 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6353 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said,

قَالَ رَجُلٌ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَنْ أَحَقُّ بِحُسْنِ الصُّحْبَةِ قَالَ « أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أَبُوكَ ثُمَّ أَدْنَاكَ أَدْنَاكَ »

A person asked, 'O Messenger of Allah! Who among people is most deserving of good treatment?' He said, 'Your mother. Then your mother. Then your mother. Then your father. Then your next of kin. Then your next of kin.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2548 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6270 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

« رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ثُمَّ رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ثُمَّ رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ». قِيلَ مَنْ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ قَالَ « مَنْ أَدْرَكَ أَبَوَيْهِ عِنْدَ الْكِبَرِ أَحَدَهُمَا أَوْ كِلَيْهِمَا فَلَمْ يَدْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ »

May his nose be rubbed in dust, may his nose be rubbed in dust, may his nose be rubbed in dust! (i.e., may he die in sorrow and shame!) It was asked, 'O Messenger of Allah! Who?' He said, 'He who finds his parents, both or one of them, in old age, yet does not get the opportunity to enter Paradise.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2551 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6279 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn 'Umar (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

أَبَرُّ الْبِرِّ أَنْ يَصِلَ الرَّجُلُ وُdَّ أَبِيهِ

The best of good deeds is to maintain a good relationship with one's father's friend.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2552 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6283 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Nawwas ibn Sam'an al-Ansari (RA), he said,

سَأَلْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- عَنِ الْبِرِّ وَالإِثْمِ فَقَالَ « الْبِرُّ حُسْنُ الْخُلُقِ وَالإِثْمُ مَا حَاكَ فِى صَدْرِكَ وَكَرِهْتَ أَنْ يَطَّلِعَ عَلَيْهِ النَّاسُ »

I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) about virtue and sin. He replied, 'Virtue is good character. And sin is what creates a prickle in your heart (chest) and you dislike that people should know about it.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2553 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6285 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA), she said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الرَّحِمُ مُعَلَّقَةٌ بِالْعَرْشِ تَقُولُ مَنْ وَصَلَنِى وَصَلَهُ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ قَطَعَنِى قَطَعَهُ اللَّهُ

The womb, that is, the bond of kinship, is hanging from the Throne of Allah. It says, 'Whoever maintains my relationship, Allah will maintain His relationship with him. And whoever severs my relationship, Allah will sever His relationship with him.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2555 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6288 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

That is, whoever maintains the bond of kinship, Allah maintains a relationship with him, He loves him. And whoever severs the bond of kinship, Allah Ta'ala also severs His relationship with him. He dislikes him.

Narrated by Abu Ayyub al-Ansari (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

لاَ يَحِلُّ لِمُسْلِمٍ أَنْ يَهْجُرَ أَخَاهُ فَوْقَ ثَلاَثِ لَيَالٍ يَلْتَقِيَانِ فَيُعْرِضُ هَذَا وَيُعْرِضُ هَذَا وَخَيْرُهُمَا الَّذِى يَبْدَأُ بِالسَّلاَمِ

It is not permissible for a Muslim to sever relations with his brother for more than three days. (When they meet on the road) one turns his face this way, and the other turns his face that way. However, the better of the two is the one who greets first.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2560 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6300 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَقُولُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ أَيْنَ الْمُتَحَابُّونَ بِجَلاَلِى الْيَوْمَ أُظِلُّهُمْ فِى ظِلِّى يَوْمَ لاَ ظِلَّ إِلاَّ ظِلِّى

On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will say, 'Where are those who loved each other for My glory? Today I will give them shade in My special shade. Today is a day when there is no shade other than My shade.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2566 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6315 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

This reward is for those who love each other solely for the pleasure of Allah. There is no worldly interest behind their love. When Muslims love each other as religious brothers, that love is also included in this.

Narrated by Thawban (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

عَائِدُ الْمَرِيضِ فِى مَخْرَفَةِ الْجَنَّةِ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ

Whoever visits a sick person remains in a garden of Paradise until he returns.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2568 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6317 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Abdullah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَا مِنْ مُسْلِمٍ يُصِيبُهُ أَذًى مِنْ مَرَضٍ فَمَا سِوَاهُ إِلاَّ حَطَّ اللَّهُ بِهِ سَيِّئَاتِهِ كَمَا تَحُطُّ الشَّجَرَةُ وَرَقَهَا

If any Muslim is afflicted with a fever or any other calamity, Allah Ta'ala forgives his sins in return, just as a tree sheds its leaves.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2571 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6325 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA), she said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَا يُصِيبُ الْمُؤْمِنَ مِنْ شَوْكَةٍ فَمَا فَوْقَهَا إِلاَّ رَفَعَهُ اللَّهُ بِهَا دَرَجَةً أَوْ حَطَّ عَنْهُ بِهَا خَطِيئَةً

If a believer is pricked by a single thorn or even a lesser affliction, Allah Ta'ala raises his rank by one degree or forgives one of his sins.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2572 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6328 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Sa'id al-Khudri and Abu Hurayrah (RA), they both heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَا يُصِيبُ الْمُؤْمِنَ مِنْ وَصَبٍ وَلاَ نَصَبٍ وَلاَ سَقَمٍ وَلاَ حَزَنٍ حَتَّى الْهَمِّ يُهَمُّهُ إِلاَّ كُفِّرَ بِهِ مِنْ سَيِّئَاتِهِ

A believer does not suffer any pain, hardship, illness, or sorrow, not even a worry that troubles him, but that some of his sins are forgiven in return.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2573 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6334 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Dharr (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, Allah Ta'ala says,

يَا عِبَادِى إِنِّى حَرَّمْتُ الظُّلْمَ عَلَى نَفْسِى وَجَعَلْتُهُ بَيْنَكُمْ مُحَرَّمًا فَلاَ تَظَالَمُوا

I have forbidden oppression for Myself. I have also forbidden mutual oppression among you. Therefore, do not oppress one another.

Sahih Muslim , Hadith 2577 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6339 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn 'Umar (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الْمُسْلِمُ أَخُو الْمُsْلِمِ لاَ يَظْلِمُهُ وَلاَ يُسْلِمُهُ مَنْ كَانَ فِى حَاجَةِ أَخِيهِ كَانَ اللَّهُ فِى حَاجَتِهِ وَمَنْ فَرَّجَ عَنْ مُسْلِمٍ كُرْبَةً فَرَّجَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ بِهَا كُرْبَةً مِنْ كُرَبِ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ وَمَنْ سَتَرَ مُسْلِمًا سَتَرَهُ اللَّهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

A Muslim is the brother of another Muslim. He does not oppress him, nor does he hand him over to the enemy. Whoever fulfills the need of his brother, Allah will fulfill his need. And whoever removes a calamity from a Muslim, Allah Ta'ala will remove one of his calamities on the Day of Resurrection in return. And whoever conceals the faults of a Muslim, Allah Ta'ala will conceal his faults on the Day of Resurrection.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2580 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6342 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Anas ibn Malik (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَيَرْضَى عَنِ الْعَبْدِ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ الأَكْلَةَ فَيَحْمَدَهُ عَلَيْهَا أَوْ يَشْرَبَ الشَّرْبَةَ فَيَحْمَدَهُ عَلَيْهَا

Allah Ta'ala is surely pleased with the servant who eats a meal and praises Allah for it, or drinks a drink and praises Allah for it.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2734 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi)

Narrated by Jabir ibn 'Abdullah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

كُلُّ مَعْرُوفٍ صَدَقَةٌ ، وَإِنَّ مِنَ الْمَعْرُوفِ أَنْ تَلْقَى أَخَاكَ بِوَجْهٍ طَلْقٍ ، وَأَنْ تُفْرِغَ مِنْ دَلْوِكَ فِي إِنَاءِ أَخِيكَ

Every good deed is a charity. Meeting your (religious) brother with a cheerful face and pouring a little water from your bucket into your brother's bucket are also included in good deeds.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1970 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir), 1976 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA),

لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ الرَّاشِيَ وَالمُرْتَشِيَ فِي الحُكْمِ

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the one who gives a bribe and the one who takes a bribe in a judgment.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1336 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 1340 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

كَلِمَتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ ثَقِيلَتَانِ فِي الْمِيزَانِ حَبِيبَتَانِ إِلَى الرَّحْمَنِ سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ سُبْحَانَ اللهِ الْعَظِيم

There are two words that are very light on the tongue but very heavy on the scales, and very dear to the Most Merciful Allah. (The two words are) Subhanallahi wa bihamdihi, Subhanallahil 'Azim.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6682 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6225 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu ad-Darda' (RA), he said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

أَلاَ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِخَيْرِ أَعْمَالِكُمْ ، وَأَزْكَاهَا عِنْدَ مَلِيكِكُمْ ، وَأَرْفَعِهَا فِي دَرَجَاتِكُمْ وَخَيْرٌ لَكُمْ مِنْ إِنْفَاقِ الذَّهَبِ وَالوَرِقِ ، وَخَيْرٌ لَكُمْ مِنْ أَنْ تَلْقَوْا عَدُوَّكُمْ فَتَضْرِبُوا أَعْنَاقَهُمْ وَيَضْرِبُوا أَعْنَاقَكُمْ ؟ قَالُوا : بَلَى. قَالَ : ذِكْرُ اللهِ تَعَالَى قَالَ مُعَاذُ بْنُ جَبَلٍ : مَا شَيْءٌ أَنْجَى مِنْ عَذَابِ اللهِ مِنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ.

Shall I not inform you of the best of your deeds, the purest of them with your Lord, the one that raises your ranks the most, is better for you than spending gold and silver in the way of Allah, and is more beneficial for you than meeting your enemy and striking their necks and they striking yours? They said, 'Yes, tell us.' He said: 'This is the remembrance of Allah Ta'ala.' Mu'adh ibn Jabal (RA) said, 'There is nothing more saving from the punishment of Allah than the remembrance of Allah.'

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3377 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Footnote:

Dhikr means remembrance. Just as saying Subhanallah, Alhamdulillah, etc. verbally is dhikr, discussing the words of Allah Ta'ala and the words of the religion is also dhikr.

Narrated by Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا خَرَجَ ثَلاَثَةٌ فِى سَفَرٍ فَلْيُؤَمِّرُوا أَحَدَهُمْ

When three people go out on a journey, they should appoint one of them as their leader.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 2608 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut), 2600 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ سَلَكَ طَرِيقًا يَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ عِلْمًا سَهَّلَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِهِ طَرِيقًا إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ وَمَا اجْتَمَعَ قَوْمٌ فِى بَيْتٍ مِنْ بُيُوتِ اللَّهِ يَتْلُونَ كِتَابَ اللَّهِ وَيَتَدَارَسُونَهُ بَيْنَهُمْ إِلاَّ نَزَلَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّكِينَةُ وَغَشِيَتْهُمُ الرَّحْمَةُ وَحَفَّتْهُمُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ وَذَكَرَهُمُ اللَّهُ فِيمَنْ عِنْدَهُ وَمَنْ بَطَّأَ بِهِ عَمَلُهُ لَمْ يُسْرِعْ بِهِ نَسَبُهُ

Whoever travels a path in search of knowledge, Allah makes the path to Paradise easy for him. When a group of people gather in one of the houses of Allah, reciting the Book of Allah and studying it among themselves, tranquility descends upon them, mercy covers them, and the angels surround them. And Allah mentions them to those who are with Him (i.e., the angels). And whoever is slowed down by his deeds, his lineage will not speed him up.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2699 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6608 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Here, seeking knowledge refers only to religious knowledge. The knowledge through which a servant can know Allah and follow His commands is intended. Many people use this hadith to explain the virtue of purely worldly knowledge. Some even use this hadith in the context of secular education that is averse to religion. This is a misapplication of this hadith, there is no doubt about it.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

سَبْعَةٌ يُظِلُّهُمُ اللَّهُ فِي ظِلِّهِ يَوْمَ لاَ ظِلَّ إِلاَّ ظِلُّهُ الإِمَامُ الْعَادِلُ وَشَابٌّ نَشَأَ فِي عِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِ وَرَجُلٌ قَلْبُهُ مُعَلَّقٌ فِي الْمَسَاجِدِ وَرَجُلاَنِ تَحَابَّا فِي اللهِ اجْتَمَعَا عَلَيْهِ وَتَفَرَّقَا عَلَيْهِ وَرَجُلٌ طَلَبَتْهُ امْرَأَةٌ ذَاتُ مَنْصِبٍ وَجَمَالٍ فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَخَافُ اللَّهَ وَرَجُلٌ تَصَدَّقَ أَخْفَى حَتَّى لاَ تَعْلَمَ شِمَالُهُ مَا تُنْفِقُ يَمِينُهُ وَرَجُلٌ ذَكَرَ اللَّهَ خَالِيًا فَفَاضَتْ عَيْنَاهُ.

On the day when there will be no shade other than the shade of Allah (His Throne), Allah will give shade to seven people in His own (Throne's) shade. 1. A just ruler, 2. A young man who has grown up in the worship of his Lord, 3. A person whose heart is attached to the mosques, 4. Two people who love each other for the sake of Allah, they meet for the sake of Allah and separate for the sake of Allah, 5. A person who is invited (to sin) by a woman of high status and beauty, but he refuses by saying, 'I fear Allah', 6. A person who gives charity so secretly that his left hand does not know what his right hand has spent, 7. A person who remembers Allah in solitude, and as a result, tears flow from his two eyes.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 660 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 627 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

الْمَلاَئِكَةُ تُصَلِّي عَلَى أَحَدِكُمْ مَا دَامَ فِي مُصَلاَّهُ مَا لَمْ يُحْدِثْ اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ اللَّهُمَّ ارْحَمْهُ.

As long as one of you remains in his place of prayer without breaking his ablution, the angels pray for him, saying, 'O Allah! Forgive him, O Allah! Have mercy on him.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 659 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 626 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا مَاتَ الإِنْسَانُ انْقَطَعَ عَنْهُ عَمَلُهُ إِلاَّ مِنْ ثَلاَثَةٍ إِلاَّ مِنْ صَدَقَةٍ جَارِيَةٍ أَوْ عِلْمٍ يُنْتَفَعُ بِهِ أَوْ وَلَدٍ صَالِحٍ يَدْعُو لَهُ

When a person dies, all his deeds come to an end except for three: (1) ongoing charity, or (2) knowledge from which benefit is derived, or (3) a righteous child who prays for him (the parents).

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1631 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 4077 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Sadaqah Jariyah is a donation in a field where the fruit of the donation does not end. For example, if someone builds a mosque. So even after his death, as long as this mosque exists, the reward for it will continue to be added to his record of deeds.

Narrated by Jabir ibn ‘Abdullah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

رَحِمَ اللَّهُ رَجُلاً سَمْحًا إِذَا بَاعَ ، وَإِذَا اشْتَرَى ، وَإِذَا اقْتَضَى

May Allah have mercy on a man who is lenient when he sells, when he buys, and when he demands his due.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2076 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 1946 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَيْنَمَا رَجُلٌ يَمْشِي بِطَرِيقٍ وَجَدَ غُصْنَ شَوْكٍ فَأَخَذَهُ فَشَكَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ فَغَفَرَ لَهُ.

While a man was walking on a road, he found a thorny branch on the road. He then removed it from the road. Allah accepted his deed and forgave him.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2472 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 2310 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ تَصَدَّقَ بِعَدْلِ تَمْرَةٍ مِنْ كَسْبٍ طَيِّبٍ ، وَلاَ يَقْبَلُ اللَّهُ إِلاَّ الطَّيِّبَ - وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يَتَقَبَّلُهَا بِيَمِينِهِ ثُمَّ يُرَبِّيهَا لِصَاحِبِهِ كَمَا يُرَبِّي أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْوَهُ حَتَّى تَكُونَ مِثْلَ الْجَبَلِ.

Whoever gives in charity the equivalent of a date from lawful earnings, (Allah will accept it) and Allah only accepts what is pure. And Allah accepts it with His (mighty) right hand. Then Allah nurtures it for the benefit of the giver, just as one of you nurtures a foal. Eventually, that charity becomes like a mountain.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1410 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 1327 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ كَذِبًا أَنْ يُحَدِّثَ بِكُلِّ مَا سَمِعَ

It is enough for a man to be a liar that he narrates everything he hears.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 5 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), Introduction section, (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Mas'ud al-Badri (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ الْمُسْلِمَ إِذَا أَنْفَقَ عَلَى أَهْلِهِ نَفَقَةً وَهُوَ يَحْتَسِبُهَا كَانَتْ لَهُ صَدَقَةً

If a Muslim spends something on his family with the hope of reward, it will be counted as a charity for him.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1002 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 2191 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA),

سُئِلَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أَيُّ الأَعْمَالِ أَحَبُّ إِلَى اللهِ قَالَ أَدْوَمُهَا وَإِنْ قَلَّ وَقَالَ اكْلَفُوا مِنَ الأَعْمَالِ مَا تُطِيقُون.

The Prophet (peace be upon him) was asked, 'What is the most beloved deed to Allah?' He said: 'The one that is done regularly, even if it is little.' He also said, 'Do as much as you are able to do.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6465 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6021 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr (RA), the Messenger (peace be upon him) said,

لَا يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ مَنَّانٌ وَلَا عَاقٌّ وَلَا مُدْمِنُ خَمْرٍ

The one who reminds others of his favors, the one who is disobedient to his parents, and the one who is addicted to alcohol will not enter Paradise.

Sunan an-Nasa'i, Hadith 5672 (Verified by Abdul Fattah Abu Ghuddah), 5675 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Abdullah ibn 'Abbas (RA), he said,

لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْمُتَشَبِّهِينَ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ بِالنِّسَاءِ وَالْمُتَشَبِّهَاتِ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ بِالرِّجَالِ.

The Prophet (peace be upon him) cursed the men who imitate women and the women who imitate men.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5885 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5465 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar (RA), the Messenger (peace be upon him) said,

خَالِفُوا الْمُشْرِكِينَ وَفِّرُوا اللِّحَى وَأَحْفُوا الشَّوَارِبَ ، وَكَانَ ابْنُ عُمَرَ إِذَا حَجَّ ، أَوِ اعْتَمَرَ قَبَضَ عَلَى لِحْيَتِهِ فَمَا فَضَلَ أَخَذَهُ.

Do the opposite of the polytheists. Lengthen your beards and shorten your mustaches. When Ibn 'Umar (RA) performed Hajj or 'Umrah, he would grasp his beard and cut off whatever was in excess of a handful.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5892 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5472 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Lengthening the beard is not an optional Sunnah. It is obligatory. Trimming the beard to less than a handful or shaving it completely are both sinful acts. And this sin is one that is committed at every moment. Many are heard to say that keeping a beard is a Sunnah, so there is no harm in not keeping it. This is not correct.

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA), she said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ أَحْدَثَ فِي أَمْرِنَا هَذَا مَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ فَهُوَ رَدٌّ.

Whoever introduces something into this Shari'ah of ours that is not in accordance with it will have it rejected.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2697 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 2517 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Whatever is newly added to the Shari'ah in the name of religion is called bid'ah (innovation). This innovation is rejectable. There is no scope for acting upon any innovation, no matter how beautiful it may seem. For example, observing the fortieth day after someone's death.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَنْ سَرَّهُ أَنْ يُبْسَطَ لَهُ فِي رِزْقِهِ ، وَأَنْ يُنْسَأَ لَهُ فِي أَثَرِهِ فَلْيَصِلْ رَحِمَهُ.

Whoever wants his provision to be expanded and his life to be prolonged, let him maintain the ties of kinship.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5985 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5559 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Jubayr ibn Mut'im (RA), he heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say,

لاَ يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ قَاطِعٌ.

The one who severs the ties of kinship will not enter Paradise.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5984 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5558 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said,

قَبَّلَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْحَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِيٍّ وَعِنْدَهُ الأَقْرَعُ بْنُ حَابِسٍ التَّمِيمِيُّ جَالِسًا فَقَالَ الأَقْرَعُ إِنَّ لِي عَشَرَةً مِنَ الْوَلَدِ مَا قَبَّلْتُ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًا فَنَظَرَ إِلَيْهِ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم ثُمَّ قَالَ مَنْ لاَ يَرْحَمُ لاَ يُرْحَمُ.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) once kissed Hasan ibn 'Ali. At that time, Aqra' ibn Habis at-Tamimi (RA) was sitting with him. Aqra' ibn Habis (RA) said: 'I have ten sons, I have never kissed any of them.' The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) looked at him. Then he said: 'He who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5997 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5571 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA), the wife of the Prophet (peace be upon him), she said,

جَاءَتْنِي امْرَأَةٌ مَعَهَا ابْنَتَانِ تَسْأَلُنِي فَلَمْ تَجِدْ عِنْدِي غَيْرَ تَمْرَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَأَعْطَيْتُهَا فَقَسَمَتْهَا بَيْنَ ابْنَتَيْهَا ثُمَّ قَامَتْ فَخَرَجَتْ فَدَخَلَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَحَدَّثْتُهُ فَقَالَ مَنْ يَلِي مِنْ هَذِهِ الْبَنَاتِ شَيْئًا فَأَحْسَنَ إِلَيْهِنَّ كُنَّ لَهُ سِتْرًا مِنَ النَّارِ.

A woman came to me with two daughters and asked for something. I found nothing with me except a single date. I gave it to her. The woman divided it between her two daughters. Then she got up and left. In the meantime, the Prophet (peace be upon him) came. I told him the incident. Then he said: 'Whoever is tested with any of these daughters, and then he treats them well, these daughters will be a shield for him from the fire of Hell.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5995 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5569 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَا مِنْ رَجُلٍ تُدْرِكُ لَهُ ابْنَتَانِ ، فَيُحْسِنُ إِلَيْهِمَا مَا صَحِبَتَاهُ ، أَوْ صَحِبَهُمَا ، إِلاَّ أَدْخَلَتَاهُ الْجَنَّةَ.

Any man who has two daughters and treats them well as long as they live together, they will cause him to enter Paradise.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3670

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا انْتَعَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالْيُمْنَى وَإِذَا خَلَعَ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالشِّمَالِ وَلْيُنْعِلْهُمَا جَمِيعًا أَوْ لِيَخْلَعْهُمَا جَمِيعًا

When one of you puts on shoes, he should first put on the right one. And when he takes them off, he should first take off the left one. And he should either wear shoes on both feet or take off the shoes from both feet.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2097 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5318 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

One cannot wear a shoe on one foot and leave the other bare. This is forbidden in this hadith. If one wears shoes, one must wear them on both feet. Otherwise, one must walk barefoot. This is the teaching of the hadith.

Narrated by Jabir ibn ‘Abdullah (RA), he said,

أُتِىَ بِأَبِى قُحَافَةَ يَوْمَ فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ وَرَأْسُهُ وَلِحْيَتُهُ كَالثَّغَامَةِ بَيَاضًا فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- « غَيِّرُوا هَذَا بِشَىْءٍ وَاجْتَنِبُوا السَّوَادَ »

On the day of the conquest of Makkah, Abu Quhafah (RA) was brought. His hair and beard were as white as 'thaghama'. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, 'Change this with something, but avoid the color black.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2102 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5331 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

If someone's hair and beard turn gray, they can use a dye of a color other than black. Black cannot be used. This is a sinful act. Yes, if someone's hair turns gray at a young age due to illness, then he can also use black dye. However, the black dyes available in the market are not at all healthy. They do more harm than good.

Narrated by Abu Talha (RA), he said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say that,

لاَ تَدْخُلُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ بَيْتًا فِيهِ كَلْبٌ ، وَلاَ صُورَةُ تَمَاثِيلَ.

The angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture (of an animal).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 3225 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 2998 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said,

نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- عَنِ الضَّرْبِ فِى الْوَجْهِ وَعَنِ الْوَسْمِ فِى الْوَجْهِ

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade striking (an animal) on the face and branding on the face.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2116 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5368 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Sa‘id al-Khudri (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

« إِيَّاكُمْ وَالْجُلُوسَ فِى الطُّرُقَاتِ ». قَالُوا يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَا لَنَا بُدٌّ مِنْ مَجَالِسِنَا نَتَحَدَّثُ فِيهَا. قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- « فَإِذَا أَبَيْتُمْ إِلاَّ الْمَجْلِسَ فَأَعْطُوا الطَّرِيقَ حَقَّهُ ». قَالُوا وَمَا حَقُّهُ قَالَ « غَضُّ الْبَصَرِ وَكَفُّ الأَذَى وَرَدُّ السَّلاَمِ وَالأَمْرُ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَالنَّهْىُ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ »

Avoid sitting on the roads. They said, 'O Messenger of Allah! We have no choice but to have our gatherings (on the roadside), where we talk (about necessary things).' The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'If you must do so, then give the road its due right.' They said, 'What is the right of the road?' He said, 'Lowering the gaze, removing harmful objects, returning greetings, enjoining what is right, and forbidding what is wrong.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2121 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5380 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (RA),

عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى الله عَليْهِ وسَلَّمَ ، أَنَّهُ لَعَنَ الْوَاصِلَةَ ، وَالْمُسْتَوْصِلَةَ ، وَالْوَاشِمَةَ ، وَالْمُسْتَوْشِمَةَ.

The Prophet (peace be upon him) cursed the woman who adds artificial hair and the one who has it done, and the one who tattoos various parts of the body and the one who has it done.

Sunan Ibn Majah 1987 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا أَتَى أَحَدَكُمْ خَادِمُهُ بِطَعَامِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يُجْلِسْهُ مَعَهُ فَلْيُنَاوِلْهُ لُقْمَةً ، أَوْ لُقْمَتَيْنِ ، أَوْ أُكْلَةً ، أَوْ أُكْلَتَيْنِ فَإِنَّهُ وَلِيَ عِلاَجَهُ.

When the servant of one of you brings his food, if he does not sit him down with him, then he should give him a morsel or two of food. For he has endured its heat and hardship.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2557 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5065 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

طَعَامُ الاِثْنَيْنِ كَافِي الثَّلاَثَةِ وَطَعَامُ الثَّلاَثَةِ كَافِي الأَرْبَعَةِ.

The food of two is enough for three, and the food of three is enough for four.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5392 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5000 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Nafi' (may Allah have mercy on him),

كَانَ ابْنُ عُمَرَ لاَ يَأْكُلُ حَتَّى يُؤْتَى بِمِسْكِينٍ يَأْكُلُ مَعَهُ فَأَدْخَلْتُ رَجُلاً يَأْكُلُ مَعَهُ فَأَكَلَ كَثِيرًا فَقَالَ يَا نَافِعُ لاَ تُدْخِلْ هَذَا عَلَيَّ سَمِعْتُ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَقُولُ الْمُؤْمِنُ يَأْكُلُ فِي مِعًى وَاحِدٍ وَالْكَافِرُ يَأْكُلُ فِي سَبْعَةِ أَمْعَاءٍ.

Ibn 'Umar (RA) would not eat until a poor person was brought to eat with him. One day I brought a person to eat with him. The man ate a lot. He said: 'Nafi'! Do not bring such people to me. I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say, 'A believer eats in one stomach. And a disbeliever eats in seven stomachs.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5393 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5001 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Juhayfah (RA), he said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

لاَ آكُلُ مُتَّكِئًا.

I do not eat while reclining.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5398 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5006 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

It is Sunnah not to recline while eating and drinking. For a healthy person who can sit and eat normally, it is undesirable to eat or drink while reclining or leaning against something. In another hadith, 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr (RA) narrates from his father that the Prophet (peace be upon him) was never seen eating while reclining in a normal state. (Sunan Abu Dawood 4/287) In another hadith, it is narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said, 'I am a slave of Allah. I eat as a slave eats and I sit for eating as a slave sits.' (Kitab az-Zuhd, p. 11) However, there is scope for eating and drinking while reclining due to illness or weakness. Because it is proven by hadith that the Prophet (peace be upon him) ate while reclining due to weakness when he was hungry. It is narrated from Anas (RA) that he said, 'Dates were presented to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and I saw him eating while reclining due to weakness from hunger.' Source: https://www.alkawsar.com/bn/qa/answers/detail/1168

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA),

كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يُحِبُّ التَّيَمُّنَ مَا اسْتَطَاعَ فِي طُهُورِهِ وَتَنَعُّلِهِ وَتَرَجُّلِهِ ،

The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to start from the right as much as possible in performing ablution, putting on shoes, and combing his hair.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5380 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 4988 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by ‘Umar ibn Abu Salamah (RA),

كُنْتُ غُلاَمًا فِي حَجْرِ رَسُولِ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَكَانَتْ يَدِي تَطِيشُ فِي الصَّحْفَةِ فَقَال لِي رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَا غُلاَمُ سَمِّ اللَّهَ وَكُلْ بِيَمِينِكَ وَكُلْ مِمَّا يَلِيكَ فَمَا زَالَتْ تِلْكَ طِعْمَتِي بَعْدُ.

I was a young boy under the care of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). My hand used to wander about in the food vessel. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said to me: 'O boy! Say Bismillah, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is near you.' After that, I always ate in this manner. (i.e., eating from one's own side.)

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5376 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 4984 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA) from the Prophet (peace be upon him), he said,

اجْتَنِبُوا السَّبْعَ الْمُوبِقَاتِ قَالُوا : يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ وَمَا هُنَّ قَالَ الشِّرْكُ بِاللَّهِ وَالسِّحْرُ وَقَتْلُ النَّفْسِ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلاَّ بِالْحَقِّ وَأَكْلُ الرِّبَا وَأَكْلُ مَالِ الْيَتِيمِ وَالتَّوَلِّي يَوْمَ الزَّحْفِ وَقَذْفُ الْمُحْصَنَاتِ الْمُؤْمِنَاتِ الْغَافِلاَتِ.

Abstain from the seven destructive things. The companions asked, 'O Messenger of Allah! What are they?' He said, '(1) Associating partners with Allah, (2) magic, (3) killing a soul whom Allah has forbidden to be killed, except for a just cause, (4) consuming usury, (5) devouring the property of an orphan, (6) fleeing from the battlefield, and (7) accusing chaste, innocent, believing women.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2766 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 2578 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn ‘Umar (RA), he said,

فَرَضَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم زَكَاةَ الْفِطْرِ صَاعًا مِنْ تَمْرٍ ، أَوْ صَاعًا مِنْ شَعِيرٍ عَلَى الْعَبْدِ وَالْحُرِّ وَالذَّكَرِ وَالأُنْثَى وَالصَّغِيرِ وَالْكَبِيرِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ وَأَمَرَ بِهَا أَنْ تُؤَدَّى قَبْلَ خُرُوجِ النَّاسِ إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) made it obligatory for every slave, free person, male, female, adult, and minor Muslim to pay one sa' of dates or one sa' of barley as Sadaqat al-Fitr, and he ordered it to be paid before the people go out for the Eid prayer.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1503 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 1415 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یَمْحَقُ اللّٰهُ الرِّبٰوا وَ یُرْبِی الصَّدَقٰتِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ لَا یُحِبُّ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ اَثِیْمٍ۝

Allah destroys usury and increases charity. And Allah does not like every ungrateful sinner.

Surah Al-Baqarah, Verse 276 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

قُلْ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِیْنَ یَغُضُّوْا مِنْ اَبْصَارِهِمْ وَ یَحْفَظُوْا فُرُوْجَهُمْ ؕ ذٰلِكَ اَزْكٰی لَهُمْ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ خَبِیْرٌۢ بِمَا یَصْنَعُوْنَ۝۳۰

Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is well-acquainted with what they do.

Surah An-Nur, Verse 30 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Narrated by 'Abdullah ibn Mughaffal (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إن اللهَ رفيق يُحِبُّ الرّفْقَ، ويُعطِي عليهِ ما لا يُعطِي على العُنْفِ

Indeed, Allah is gentle and loves gentleness. He gives for gentleness what He does not give for harshness.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 4807 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut) 4732 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Buraydah (RA) said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said to 'Ali (RA),

يا عليُّ، لا تُتْبِعِ النظرةَ النظرةَ، فإن لك الأولى، وليست لك الآخرة

O 'Ali! Do not follow a glance with another (intentional) glance. For the first (unintentional) glance is permissible for you, but the second (intentional) glance is not lawful.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 2149 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut) 2146 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَ عَمِلُوا الصّٰلِحٰتِ وَ اَقَامُوا الصَّلٰوةَ وَ اٰتَوُا الزَّكٰوةَ لَهُمْ اَجْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ وَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لَا هُمْ یَحْزَنُوْنَ۝۲۷۷

Those who believe, do righteous deeds, establish prayer, and give zakah will have their reward with their Lord. They will have no fear, nor will they grieve.

Surah Al-Baqarah, Verse 277 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said,

لَعَنَ رسولُ الله ﷺ الرَّجُلَ يلبس لِبسةَ المرأةِ، والمرأة تَلْبَسُ لِبْسَةَ الرجُلِ

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the men who wear women's clothing and the women who wear men's clothing.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 4098 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut) 4054 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إذا زَنَى الرَّجُلُ خَرجَ منه الإيمانُ كان عليه كالظُّلَّة، فإذا أقْلَعَ رَجَعَ إليه الإيمان

When someone commits adultery, faith leaves him and remains over him like a shadow. Then when he stops, faith returns to him.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 4690 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut) 4617 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ كَانَتْ لَهُ امْرَأَتَانِ فَمَالَ إِلَى إِحْدَاهُمَا ، جَاءَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَشِقُّهُ مَائِلٌ.

Whoever has two wives and is more inclined towards one of them will come on the Day of Resurrection with one side of his body paralyzed.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 2133 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut) 2130 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

قَالَ اللَّهُ : كُلُّ عَمَلِ ابْنِ آدَمَ لَهُ إِلاَّ الصِّيَامَ فَإِنَّهُ لِي وَأَنَا أَجْزِي بِهِ وَالصِّيَامُ جُنَّةٌ ، وَإِذَا كَانَ يَوْمُ صَوْمِ أَحَدِكُمْ فَلاَ يَرْفُثْ ، وَلاَ يَصْخَبْ فَإِنْ سَابَّهُ أَحَدٌ ، أَوْ قَاتَلَهُ فَلْيَقُلْ إِنِّي امْرُؤٌ صَائِمٌ وَالَّذِي نَفْسُ مُحَمَّدٍ بِيَدِهِ لَخُلُوفُ فَمِ الصَّائِمِ أَطْيَبُ عِنْدَ اللهِ مِنْ رِيحِ الْمِسْكِ لِلصَّائِمِ فَرْحَتَانِ يَفْرَحُهُمَا إِذَا أَفْطَرَ فَرِحَ ، وَإِذَا لَقِيَ رَبَّهُ فَرِحَ بِصَوْمِهِ.

Allah the Almighty has said, 'Every deed of the son of Adam is for him, except for fasting, which is for Me, and I will give the reward for it.' Fasting is a shield. None of you should indulge in obscene talk or quarrel on the day of fasting. If someone abuses him or fights with him, he should say, 'I am a fasting person.' By Him in Whose Hand is the life of Muhammad, the smell of the mouth of a fasting person is more fragrant to Allah than the smell of musk. There are two joys for the fasting person which make him happy. When he breaks his fast, he is happy, and when he meets his Lord, he will be happy because of his fasting.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1904 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 1783 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Although every deed of the son of Adam is done for the sake of Allah, in this hadith, fasting is specifically mentioned as being for Allah. The reason for this is that fasting is a deed that can only be performed for the pleasure of Allah. There is no fear of riya (showing off) in fasting as there is in other deeds. In some hadiths, the matter is described as - he gives up his desires for My sake. That is, a person fasts by giving up food, drink, and sexual desire solely for the pleasure of Allah. There is no room for riya in this fast.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

اَلَّذِیْنَ یَاْكُلُوْنَ الرِّبٰوا لَا یَقُوْمُوْنَ اِلَّا كَمَا یَقُوْمُ الَّذِیْ یَتَخَبَّطُهُ الشَّیْطٰنُ مِنَ الْمَسِّ ؕ ذٰلِكَ بِاَنَّهُمْ قَالُوْۤا اِنَّمَا الْبَیْعُ مِثْلُ الرِّبٰوا ۘ وَ اَحَلَّ اللّٰهُ الْبَیْعَ وَ حَرَّمَ الرِّبٰوا ؕ فَمَنْ جَآءَهٗ مَوْعِظَةٌ مِّنْ رَّبِّهٖ فَانْتَهٰی فَلَهٗ مَا سَلَفَ ؕ وَ اَمْرُهٗۤ اِلَی اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ مَنْ عَادَ فَاُولٰٓىِٕكَ اَصْحٰبُ النَّارِ ۚ هُمْ فِیْهَا خٰلِدُوْنَ۝

Those who consume usury will not stand (on the Day of Resurrection) except as one stands who is being beaten by Satan into insanity. That is because they say, 'Trade is just like usury.' But Allah has permitted trade and has forbidden usury. So whoever has received an admonition from his Lord and desists may have what is past, and his affair is for Allah. But whoever returns [to dealing in usury] - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.

Surah Al-Baqarah, Verse 275 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

وَ قُلْ لِّلْمُؤْمِنٰتِ یَغْضُضْنَ مِنْ اَبْصَارِهِنَّ وَ یَحْفَظْنَ فُرُوْجَهُنَّ وَ لَا یُبْدِیْنَ زِیْنَتَهُنَّ اِلَّا مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا وَ لْیَضْرِبْنَ بِخُمُرِهِنَّ عَلٰی جُیُوْبِهِنَّ ۪ وَ لَا یُبْدِیْنَ زِیْنَتَهُنَّ اِلَّا لِبُعُوْلَتِهِنَّ اَوْ اٰبَآىِٕهِنَّ اَوْ اٰبَآءِ بُعُوْلَتِهِنَّ اَوْ اَبْنَآىِٕهِنَّ اَوْ اَبْنَآءِ بُعُوْلَتِهِنَّ اَوْ اِخْوَانِهِنَّ اَوْ بَنِیْۤ اِخْوَانِهِنَّ اَوْ بَنِیْۤ اَخَوٰتِهِنَّ اَوْ نِسَآىِٕهِنَّ اَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ اَیْمَانُهُنَّ اَوِ التّٰبِعِیْنَ غَیْرِ اُولِی الْاِرْبَةِ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ اَوِ الطِّفْلِ الَّذِیْنَ لَمْ یَظْهَرُوْا عَلٰی عَوْرٰتِ النِّسَآءِ ۪ وَ لَا یَضْرِبْنَ بِاَرْجُلِهِنَّ لِیُعْلَمَ مَا یُخْفِیْنَ مِنْ زِیْنَتِهِنَّ ؕ وَ تُوْبُوْۤا اِلَی اللّٰهِ جَمِیْعًا اَیُّهَ الْمُؤْمِنُوْنَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُوْنَ۝

And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their private parts and not to display their adornment except what is apparent of it. And let them draw their veils over their bosoms and not display their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.

Surah An-Nur, Verse 31 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

In this verse, women are commanded to cover their entire bodies with a large sheet or burqa in front of non-mahram or foreign men, so that they cannot see the parts of women's adornment. However, if such a part of the body is revealed on its own while doing work or needs to be revealed for a special reason, there will be no sin. Regarding that, it has been said, 'except what is apparent of it'. Ibn Jarir...

Narrated by 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ اقْتَطَعَ مَالَ أَخِيهِ الْمُسْلِمِ بِيَمِينٍ لَقِيَ اللَّهَ وَهُوَ عَلَيْهِ غَضْبَانُ

Whoever seizes the property of his Muslim brother by a false oath will meet Allah while He is angry with him.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3012 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by 'Abdullah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إيَّاكم والكَذِبَ، فإنَّ الكَذبَ يهدي إلى الفُجُورِ، وإنَّ الفجورَ يهدي إلى النار

Avoid lying. For lying leads to wickedness, and wickedness leads to Hell.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 4989 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut), 4904 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Umamah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

أَنَا زَعِيمٌ بِبَيْتٍ فِي رَبَضِ الْجَنَّةِ لِمَنْ تَرَكَ الْمِرَاءَ وَإِنْ كَانَ مُحِقًّا ، وَبِبَيْتٍ فِي وَسَطِ الْجَنَّةِ لِمَنْ تَرَكَ الْكَذِبَ وَإِنْ كَانَ مَازِحًا وَبِبَيْتٍ فِي أَعْلَى الْجَنَّةِ لِمَنْ حَسَّنَ خُلُقَهُ.

I am a guarantor of a house in the outskirts of Paradise for one who gives up arguing even if he is in the right. I am a guarantor of a house in the middle of Paradise for one who gives up lying even in jest. And I am a guarantor of a house in the highest part of Paradise for one who has beautified his character.

Sunan Abu Dawood 4800 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut), 4725 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰبَنِیْۤ اٰدَمَ قَدْ اَنْزَلْنَا عَلَیْكُمْ لِبَاسًا یُّوَارِیْ سَوْاٰتِكُمْ وَ رِیْشًا ؕ وَ لِبَاسُ التَّقْوٰی ۙ ذٰلِكَ خَیْرٌ ؕ ذٰلِكَ مِنْ اٰیٰتِ اللّٰهِ لَعَلَّهُمْ یَذَّكَّرُوْنَ۝۲۶

O children of Adam! I have provided you with clothing that covers the parts of your body that are shameful to expose and that is an adornment. But the clothing of righteousness is the best. These are among the signs of Allah, so that people may take heed.

Surah Al-A'raf, Verse 26 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

In this verse, in the context of discussing clothing, it has also been made clear that just as clothing covers a person's outer self, so too does taqwa (piety) protect a person's inner and outer self by keeping him pure from sin. In this sense, the clothing of taqwa is the best clothing. Therefore, along with wearing external clothing, a person should also be concerned about adorning himself with the clothing of taqwa.

Narrated by Mu'awiyah al-Qushayri (RA), he said,

أَتَيْتُ رَسُولَ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم ، قَالَ : فَقُلْتُ : مَا تَقُولُ فِي نِسَائِنَا قَالَ : أَطْعِمُوهُنَّ مِمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ ، وَاكْسُوهُنَّ مِمَّا تَكْتَسُونَ ، وَلاَ تَضْرِبُوهُنَّ ، وَلاَ تُقَبِّحُوهُنَّ.

Once I came to the service of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and asked him, 'What do you command regarding the rights of our wives?' He said: 'Feed them with what you eat. Clothe them with what you wear. Do not beat them and do not abuse them.'

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 2144 (Verified by Shu'ayb Arna'ut) 2141 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

وَ اتَّقُوْا یَوْمًا تُرْجَعُوْنَ فِیْهِ اِلَی اللّٰهِ ۫ۗ ثُمَّ تُوَفّٰی كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا كَسَبَتْ وَ هُمْ لَا یُظْلَمُوْنَ۠۝۲۸۱

And fear a Day when you will all be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be paid in full for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

Surah Al-Baqarah, Verse 281 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say,

إِنَّ عَبْدًا أَصَابَ ذَنْبًا ، وَرُبَّمَا قَالَ أَذْنَبَ ذَنْبًا - فَقَالَ رَبِّ أَذْنَبْتُ ، وَرُبَّمَا قَالَ أَصَبْتُ - فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَقَالَ رَبُّهُ أَعَلِمَ عَبْدِي أَنَّ لَهُ رَبًّا يَغْفِرُ الذَّنْبَ وَيَأْخِرُ بِهِ غَفَرْتُ لِعَبْدِي ثُمَّ مَكَثَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ثُمَّ أَصَابَ ذَنْبًا ، أَوْ أَذْنَبَ ذَنْبًا فَقَالَ رَبِّ أَذْنَبْتُ ، أَوْ أَصَبْتُ - آخَرَ فَاغْفِرْهُ فَقَالَ أَعَلِمَ عَبْدِي أَنَّ لَهُ رَبًّا يَغْفِرُ الذَّنْبَ وَيَأْخُذُ بِهِ غَفَرْتُ لِعَبْدِي ثُمَّ مَكَثَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ثُمَّ أَذْنَبَ ذَنْبًا ، وَرُبَّمَا قَالَ أَصَابَ ذَنْبًا- قَالَ : قَالَ رَبِّ أَصَبْتُ ، أَوْ أَذْنَبْتُ - آخَرَ فَاغْفِرْهُ لِي فَقَالَ أَعَلِمَ عَبْدِي أَنَّ لَهُ رَبًّا يَغْفِرُ الذَّنْبَ وَيَأْخُذُ بِهِ غَفَرْتُ لِعَبْدِي - ثَلاَثًا - فَلْيَعْمَلْ مَا شَاءَ.

A servant committed a sin. Then he said, 'O my Lord! I have committed a sin. So forgive my sin.' His Lord said: 'Does My servant know that he has a Lord who forgives sins and also punishes for them? I have forgiven My servant.' Then he spent some time as Allah willed, and he fell into sin again. The servant said again, 'O my Lord! I have committed another sin. Forgive this sin of mine.' Then Allah said: 'Does My servant know that he has a Lord who forgives sins and also punishes for them? I have forgiven My servant.' Then the servant remained in that state for some time as Allah willed. Then he fell into sin again. He said, 'O my Lord! I have committed another sin. Forgive this sin of mine.' Then Allah said: 'Does My servant know that he has a Lord who forgives sins and also punishes for them? I have forgiven this servant of Mine.' He said this three times.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 7507 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6998 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ تَرَدَّى مِنْ جَبَلٍ فَقَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ فَهْوَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ يَتَرَدَّى فِيهِ خَالِدًا مُخَلَّدًا فِيهَا أَبَدًا ، وَمَنْ تَحَسَّى سَمًّا فَقَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ فَسَمُّهُ فِي يَدِهِ يَتَحَسَّاهُ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدًا مُخَلَّدًا فِيهَا أَبَدًا ، وَمَنْ قَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ بِحَدِيدَةٍ فَحَدِيدَتُهُ فِي يَدِهِ يَجَأُ بِهَا فِي بَطْنِهِ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدًا مُخَلَّدًا فِيهَا أَبَدًا.

Whoever throws himself from a mountain and commits suicide will be in the fire of Hell. He will continue to throw himself in Hell forever. Whoever drinks poison and commits suicide, his poison will be in his hand in the fire of Hell. He will continue to drink it in Hell forever. Whoever kills himself with an iron weapon, that iron will be in his hand in the fire of Hell. He will continue to strike his own stomach with it forever.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5778 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5363 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Qatadah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا شَرِبَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلاَ يَتَنَفَّسْ فِي الإِنَاءِ ، وَإِذَا أَتَى الْخَلاَءَ فَلاَ يَمَسَّ ذَكَرَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ ، وَلاَ يَتَمَسَّحْ بِيَمِينِهِ.

When one of you drinks water, he should not breathe into the vessel. And when he goes to the toilet, he should not touch his private parts with his right hand and should not perform istinja with his right hand.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 153 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 155 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

The Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

لَوِ اطَّلَعَ فِي بَيْتِكَ أَحَدٌ وَلَمْ تَأْذَنْ لَهُ خَذَفْتَهُ بِحَصَاةٍ فَفَقَأْتَ عَيْنَهُ مَا كَانَ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ جُنَاحٍ

If someone peeps into your house without your permission and you throw a stone and put out his eye, there will be no sin on you.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6888 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6421 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

From this, it is understood that there is no question of entering someone's house without permission, and even peeking inside is a great wrong.

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA),

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ إِذَا أَوَى إِلَى فِرَاشِهِ كُلَّ لَيْلَةٍ جَمَعَ كَفَّيْهِ ثُمَّ نَفَثَ فِيهِمَا فَقَرَأَ فِيهِمَا {قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ} ، وَ{قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ} ، وَ{قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ} ثُمَّ يَمْسَحُ بِهِمَا مَا اسْتَطَاعَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ يَبْدَأُ بِهِمَا عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَوَجْهِهِ وَمَا أَقْبَلَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ يَفْعَلُ ذَلِكَ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ.

Every night when the Prophet (peace be upon him) went to bed, he would recite Surah Al-Ikhlas, Surah Al-Falaq, and Surah An-Nas, join his hands, blow on them, and wipe his entire body with his hands. He would start with his head and face, then wipe the front of his body, and he would do this three times.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5017 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 4648 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by ‘Aisha (RA),

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ إِذَا اغْتَسَلَ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ bَدَأَ فَغَسَلَ يَدَيْهِ ثُمَّ يَتَوَضَّأُ كَمَا يَتَوَضَّأُ لِلصَّلاَةِ ثُمَّ يُدْخِلُ أَصَابِعَهُ فِي الْمَاءِ فَيُخَلِّلُ بِهَا أُصُولَ شَعَرِهِ ثُمَّ يَصُبُّ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ ثَلاَثَ غُرَفٍ بِيَدَيْهِ ثُمَّ يُفِيضُ الْمَاءَ عَلَى جِلْدِهِ كُلِّهِ.

When the Prophet (peace be upon him) would perform ghusl (obligatory bath) from janabah, he would first wash his two hands. Then he would perform ablution like the ablution for prayer. Then he would dip his fingers in the water and run them through the roots of his hair. Then he would pour three handfuls of water on his head with both hands. Then he would pour water over his entire body.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 248 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 246 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

لَوْلاَ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَى أُمَّتِي ، أَوْ عَلَى النَّاسِ - لأَمَرْتُهُمْ بِالسِّوَاكِ مَعَ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 887 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 843 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)
