Chewing a tree branch to soften it and then cleaning the teeth and mouth with it is called using a miswak. It is also part of the Sunnah to use the miswak after waking up from sleep, while performing ablution, when the smell of the mouth changes, while reciting the Quran, and upon entering the house.

Narrated by 'Ubadah ibn as-Samit (RA), he said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ تَعَارَّ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَقَالَ : لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسُبْحَانَ اللهِ ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ ، وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي ، أَوْ دَعَا اسْتُجِيبَ فَإِنْ تَوَضَّأَ وَصَلَّى قُبِلَتْ صَلاَتُهُ.

Whoever wakes up at night and says, لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ‏.‏ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ‏. Meaning, 'There is no true deity but Allah. He is one and has no partner. To Him belongs the dominion and all praise. He has power over all things. All praise is due to Allah. He is pure and great. There is no power to do good and no strength to avoid evil except with His help.' Then if he asks for forgiveness from Allah by saying, اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي‏. 'O Allah! Forgive me' or makes another supplication, his supplication is accepted.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1154 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 1087 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by ‘Aisha (RA), she said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا نَعَسَ أَحَدُكُمْ وَهُوَ يُصَلِّي فَلْيَرْقُدْ حَتَّى يَذْهَبَ عَنْهُ النَّوْمُ فَإِنَّ أَحَدَكُمْ إِذَا صَلَّى وَهُوَ نَاعِسٌ لاَ يَدْرِي لَعَلَّهُ يَسْتَغْفِرُ فَيَسُبَّ نَفْسَهُ

If one of you feels drowsy while praying, he should sleep until the drowsiness is gone. Because if he prays while drowsy, he will not know, he may be cursing himself while asking for forgiveness.

Sahih al-Bukhari 212 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Umar (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا جَاءَ أَحَدُكُمُ الْجُمُعَةَ فَلْيَغْتَسِلْ.

When one of you comes to the Jumu'ah prayer, he should take a bath (beforehand).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 877 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 833 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) discussed the day of Jumu'ah and said,

فِيهِ سَاعَةٌ لاَ يُوَافِقُهَا عَبْدٌ مُسْلِمٌ وَهْوَ قَائِمٌ يُصَلِّي يَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ تَعَالَى شَيْئًا إِلاَّ أَعْطَاهُ إِيَّاهُ . وَأَشَارَ بِيَدِهِ يُقَلِّلُهَا.

There is a moment on this day, if any Muslim servant stands in prayer at this time and asks Allah for something, He will surely grant it to him. And he indicated with his hand that the moment is very brief.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 935 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 888 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said,

أَوْصَانِي خَلِيلِي بِثَلاَثٍ لاَ أَدَعُهُنَّ حَتَّى أَمُوتَ صَوْمِ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ كُلِّ شَهْرٍ وَصَلاَةِ الضُّحَى وَنَوْمٍ عَلَى وِتْرٍ.

My close friend (the Prophet, peace be upon him) advised me to do three things. I will not abandon them until I die. (The three things are) 1. Fasting for three days every month, 2. Praying Salat ad-Duha (the mid-morning prayer), and 3. Sleeping after praying Witr.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1178 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 1108 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ka’b (ibn Malik) (RA),

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ إِذَا قَدِمَ مِنْ سَفَرٍ ضُحًى دَخَلَ الْمَسْجِدَ فَصَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَجْلِسَ.

When the Prophet (peace be upon him) returned from a journey in the mid-morning, he would enter the mosque and pray two rak'ahs of prayer before sitting down.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 3088 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 2870 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Sa’id al-Khudri (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا اسْتَأْذَنَ أَحَدُكُمْ ثَلاَثًا فَلَمْ يُؤْذَنْ لَهُ فَلْيَرْجِعْ

If one of you seeks permission to enter (someone's house) three times, but is not given permission, then he should go back.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6245 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5811 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Musa (RA), he said,

وُلِدَ لِي غُلاَمٌ فَأَتَيْتُ بِهِ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَسَمَّاهُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ فَحَنَّكَهُ بِتَمْرَةٍ وَدَعَا لَهُ بِالْبَرَكَةِ وَدَفَعَهُ إِلَيَّ.

A son was born to me, so I took him to the Prophet (peace be upon him). He named him Ibrahim. Then he performed tahnik for him with a date (i.e., he chewed a date and put it in his mouth) and prayed for his blessing and gave him to me.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5467 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5071 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا انْتَعَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالْيَمِينِ ، وَإِذَا نَزَعَ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالشِّمَالِ لِتَكُنِ الْيُمْنَى أَوَّلَهُمَا تُنْعَلُ وَآخِرَهُمَا تُنْزَعُ.

When one of you puts on shoes, he should start with the right. And when he takes them off, he should start with the left, so that the right foot is the first to be shod and the last to be unshod.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5855 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5437 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

That is, it is Sunnah to put on the right shoe first when putting on shoes and to take off the left shoe first when taking them off.

Narrated by Ibn ‘Abbas (RA),

أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم شَرِبَ لَبَنًا فَمَضْمَضَ وَقَالَ إِنَّ لَهُ دَسَمًا.

Once the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) drank milk. Then he rinsed his mouth and said: 'It contains fatty substances' (so it is good to rinse the mouth).

Sahih al-Bukhari 211 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said,

مَا عَابَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم طَعَامًا قَطُّ إِنِ اشْتَهَاهُ أَكَلَهُ وَإِنْ كَرِهَهُ تَرَكَهُ.

The Prophet (peace be upon him) never found fault with any food. If he liked it, he would eat it, and if he disliked it, he would leave it.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5409 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5015 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِيَّاكُمْ وَالظَّنَّ فَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ أَكْذَبُ الْحَدِيثِ ، وَلاَ تَحَسَّسُوا ، وَلاَ تَجَسَّسُوا ، وَلاَ تَنَاجَشُوا ، وَلاَ تَحَاسَدُوا ، وَلاَ تَبَاغَضُوا ، وَلاَ تَدَابَرُوا وَكُونُوا عِبَادَ اللهِ إِخْوَانًا.

Beware of suspicion, for suspicion is the falsest of speech. Do not pry into the faults of others, do not spy, do not deceive one another, do not envy one another, do not hate one another, and do not turn your backs on one another. Rather, be servants of Allah, brothers to one another.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6066 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5640 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

The suspicion that is to be avoided here is to have a bad opinion about someone based on suspicion. It is a sin to have a bad opinion about someone based on suspicion.

Narrated by Al-Aswad (RA), he said,

سَأَلْتُ عَائِشَةَ مَا كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَصْنَعُ فِي بَيْتِهِ قَالَتْ كَانَ يَكُونُ فِي مِهْنَةِ أَهْلِهِ - تَعْنِي خِدْمَةَ أَهْلِهِ - فَإِذَا حَضَرَتِ الصَّلاَةُ خَرَجَ إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ.

I asked 'Aisha (RA), 'What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) do when he was at home?' She said, 'He would be busy with household chores, meaning helping his family. And when the time for prayer came, he would go out for prayer.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 676 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 642 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

This hadith shows that when a man is at home, it is a great act of reward to help his wife with household chores. And if someone helps his mother with her chores, the reward will be even greater.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA),

أَنَّ رَجُلاً قَالَ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أَوْصِنِي قَالَ : لاَ تَغْضَبْ فَرَدَّدَ مِرَارًا قَالَ : لاَ تَغْضَبْ.

A man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: 'Advise me.' He said, 'Do not get angry.' The man repeated it several times. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said each time, 'Do not get angry.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6116 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5686 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Uthman ibn 'Affan (RA), he said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَنْ بَنَى مَسْجِدًا يَبْتَغِي بِهِ وَجْهَ اللهِ بَنَى اللَّهُ لَهُ مِثْلَهُ فِي الْجَنَّةِ.

Whoever builds a mosque seeking the pleasure of Allah, Allah will build a similar house for him in Paradise.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 450 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 437 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

'Umar (RA) said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

لَوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَوَكَّلُونَ عَلَى اللهِ حَقَّ تَوَكُّلِهِ لَرُزِقْتُمْ كَمَا يُرْزَقُ الطَّيْرُ تَغْدُو خِمَاصًا وَتَرُوحُ بِطَانًا.

If you were to trust in Allah as He should be trusted, He would provide for you as He provides for the birds. They go out in the morning with empty stomachs and return in the evening with full stomachs.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2344 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 79

Anas (RA) said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ قَالَ - يَعْنِي ، إِذَا خَرَجَ مِنْ بَيْتِهِ -: بِسْمِ اللهِ ، تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللهِ ، لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ ، يُقَالُ لَهُ : كُفِيتَ ، وَوُقِيتَ ، وَتَنَحَّى عَنْهُ الشَّيْطَانُ.

Whoever says (when leaving his house), بِسْمِ اللهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللهِ وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ اِلَّا بِاللهِ Meaning: I leave in the name of Allah, I trust in Allah, and there is no power to avoid sin and no ability to do good except with the help of Allah. It is said to him, 'You have been guided. Your responsibility has been taken, and you have been protected.' And Satan moves away from him.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3426 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 83

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَالَ مَنْ عَادَى لِي وَلِيًّا فَقَدْ آذَنْتُهُ بِالْحَرْبِ وَمَا تَقَرَّبَ إِلَيَّ عَبْدِي بِشَيْءٍ أَحَبَّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا افْتَرَضْتُ عَلَيْهِ وَمَا يَزَالُ عَبْدِي يَتَقَرَّبُ إِلَيَّ بِالنَّوَافِلِ حَتَّى أُحِبَّهُ فَإِذَا أَحْبَبْتُهُ كُنْتُ سَمْعَهُ الَّذِي يَسْمَعُ بِهِ وَبَصَرَهُ الَّذِي يُبْصِرُ بِهِ وَيَدَهُ الَّتِي يَبْطُشُ بِهَا وَرِجْلَهُ الَّتِي يَمْشِي بِهَا وَإِنْ سَأَلَنِي لأُعْطِيَنَّهُ وَلَئِنِ اسْتَعَاذَنِي لأُعِيذَنَّهُ

Allah Ta'ala says, 'Whoever shows enmity to a friend of Mine, I declare war against him. There is nothing with which My servant draws nearer to Me that is dearer to Me than what I have enjoined upon him. My servant continues to draw nearer to Me with supererogatory deeds until I love him. And when I love him, I become his hearing with which he hears, his sight with which he sees, his hand with which he strikes, and his foot with which he walks. Then if he asks Me for something, I give it to him, and if he seeks refuge in Me, I will surely grant him refuge.'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6502 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 95

Footnote:

In this hadith, Allah Ta'ala informs that when a servant engages in supererogatory acts in addition to obligatory worship, Allah Ta'ala loves him. In this way, the servant becomes a friend and beloved of Allah. And when he becomes His friend and He loves him, He becomes his ears, eyes, hands, and feet. This does not mean that Allah Ta'ala takes on a human form. It is not that He becomes a human; rather, He helps him to use these limbs correctly. People commit most sins with these limbs. When a person becomes a friend and beloved of Allah, he is able to avoid sin with the help of Allah and these limbs...

Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

نِعْمَتَانِ مَغْبُونٌ فِيهِمَا كَثِيرٌ مِنَ النَّاسِ الصِّحَّةُ وَالْفَرَاغ.

There are two blessings in which many people are at a loss: good health and free time.

Sahih al-Bukhari 6412 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 97

Footnote:

The teachings of this hadith: a. Good health is a great blessing from Allah Ta'ala. It is necessary to be grateful for it. b. Since good health is a great blessing from Allah Ta'ala, it is obligatory to protect it. c. People waste their free time in vain. Yet it is a great opportunity for worship. Therefore, it is the duty of everyone to make good use of this opportunity. d. Good health and free time are like capital for earning reward. Therefore, it is the duty of everyone to be careful that this capital is not wasted without earning reward.

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA), she said,

أَنَّ نَبِيَّ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ يَقُومُ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ حَتَّى تَتَفَطَّرَ قَدَمَاهُ فَقَالَتْ عَائِشَةُ لِمَ تَصْنَعُ هَذَا يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ وَقَدْ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَكَ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِكَ وَمَا تَأَخَّرَ قَالَ أَفَلاَ أُحِبُّ أَنْ أَكُونَ عَبْدًا شَكُورًا

The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to stand in prayer at night for so long that his two feet would swell and crack. I once said, 'O Messenger of Allah! Why do you do this, when Allah has forgiven your past and future faults?' He said, 'Should I not like to be a grateful servant of Allah?'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 4837 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 4478 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الْمُؤْمِنُ الْقَوِىُّ خَيْرٌ وَأَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِ الضَّعِيفِ وَفِى كُلٍّ خَيْرٌ احْرِصْ عَلَى مَا يَنْفَعُكَ وَاسْتَعِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَلاَ تَعْجِزْ وَإِنْ أَصَابَكَ شَىْءٌ فَلاَ تَقُلْ لَوْ أَنِّى فَعَلْتُ كَانَ كَذَا وَكَذَا. وَلَكِنْ قُلْ قَدَرُ اللَّهِ وَمَا شَاءَ فَعَلَ فَإِنَّ لَوْ تَفْتَحُ عَمَلَ الشَّيْطَانِ

A strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than a weak believer. However, there is good in everyone. Be keen on what is beneficial to you and seek help from Allah. Do not become helpless. If a calamity befalls you, do not say, 'If I had done such and such, it would have been so and so.' Rather, say, 'Allah has decreed this. He has done what He willed.' For the word 'if' opens the way for the work of Satan.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2664 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6532 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

حُجِبَتِ النَّارُ بِالشَّهَوَاتِ وَحُجِبَتِ الْجَنَّةُ بِالْمَكَارِهِ.

Hell has been veiled with various desires. And Paradise has been veiled with hardships.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6487 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6043 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Anas (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

يَتْبَعُ الْمَيِّتَ ثَلاَثَةٌ فَيَرْجِعُ اثْنَانِ وَيَبْقَى مَعَهُ وَاحِدٌ يَتْبَعُهُ أَهْلُهُ وَمَالُهُ وَعَمَلُهُ فَيَرْجِعُ أَهْلُهُ وَمَالُهُ وَيَبْقَى عَمَلُهُ.

Three things follow a deceased person: his family, his wealth, and his deeds. Two of them return, and one remains with him. His family and wealth return, and his deeds remain.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6514 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6070 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu 'Amr Sufyan ibn 'Abdullah (RA), he said,

قُلْتُ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ قُلْ لِى فِى الإِسْلاَمِ قَوْلاً لاَ أَسْأَلُ عَنْهُ أَحَدًا بَعْدَكَ - وَفِى حَدِيثِ أَبِى أُسَامَةَ غَيْرَكَ - قَالَ « قُلْ آمَنْتُ بِاللَّهِ فَاسْتَقِمْ »

I said, 'O Messenger of Allah! Tell me something about Islam that I will not have to ask anyone else about after you.' He said, 'Say, I have believed in Allah. Then remain steadfast (on it).'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 38 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 66 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh) Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 85

Footnote:

To be steadfast on faith means to obey all the commands of the Shari'ah exactly as they have been commanded to be obeyed. Not to add or subtract anything from it. Not to deviate to one side and not to be a victim of any kind of extremism or laxity. At the same time, to completely abstain from whatever has been forbidden.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

قَارِبُوا ، وَسَدِّدُوا ، فَإِنَّهُ لَيْسَ أَحَدٌ مِنْكُمْ يُنْجِيهِ عَمَلُهُ ، قَالُوا : وَلاَ أَنْتَ ؟ يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ ، قَالَ : وَلاَ أَنَا ، إِلاَّ أَنْ يَتَغَمَّدَنِي اللَّهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِنْهُ ، وَفَضْلٍ.

Maintain balance and be steadfast on it. Know that none of you will be saved by his own deeds. The companions asked, 'O Messenger of Allah! Not even you?' He said, 'Not even me, unless Allah covers me with His mercy and grace.'

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 4201 Source: Riyad as-Salihin, 2nd Volume, Published by Maktabatul Ashraf, Hadith No. 86
